info.title: Chronicle SOAR API
info.description: This page lists all of the REST APIs associated with Chronicle SOAR

get.summary: Test connectivity with the publisher by publisher identifier.
Returns the list of publishers configured in your environment.
Returns the list of publishers configured in your environment by their identifier.

post.summary: Adds or updates the publisher settings
Deletes the publisher configured in your environment.

get.summary: Returns the list of all Agents configured in your environment (enabled and disabled).
Returns a list of all the enabled Agents in your environment.

Returns a list with all agents, flagged for connector installation as: available, non available over connection
error and non available over misconfiguration(integration was not installed on agent), in a specific env,
for a specific integration.

Returns a list with all agents, flagged for connector test in ide as: available, non available over connection
error, non available over misconfiguration(integration was not installed on agent), or non supported versions
of agents and publisher, in a specific env, for a specific integration.
Returns a list of all the optional environments to create an Agent on.
Returns a list of all the Agents configured in your environment (enabled and disabled) by their identifier.
Returns the Agent settings for each integration instance.
get.description: communicationStatus: Live = 0, Error = 1, Disabled = 2, WaitingForAgent = 3, Deleted = 4; connectivityFlag: Master = 0, Slave = 1, None = 2.

post.summary: Returns a list of all Agents by their environment.

get.summary: Returns the Agent settings by agent identifiers.

post.summary: Returns List of Agent information data by agent identifiers.
Adds an Agent to your environment.
Updates the Agent settings.
Deletes an Agent in your environment.
Creates a custom (simulated) case.
Returns the details of a custom (simulated) case in your environment.

get.summary: Exports a custom (simulated) case as a json file.

post.summary: Import a custom (simulated) case from a json file.
Deletes a given use case.
Simulates a case (the case will be presented in the case queue).
Simulate a specific alert within a case in your environment (the alert is then presented as a Test case in your case queue).

get.summary: Returns a list of all of the custom (simulated) cases you have in your environment.
Returns true if customCase name already exists.
Returns all the data related to a single case, based on a given Case identifier

post.summary: Returns the summary of an executed playbook for a given case including the alert and playbook Identifiers.
Creates an insight for a case.
Creates a manual case that will be displayed in your case queue in the same way as other cases.

Returns minimal data related to the case (CaseCard Object).
To fetch the entire case data, use the GetCaseFullDetails method. For a more comprehensive query, you can use the search Controller.

get.summary: Returns the attachment file content in a case as a byte array.

post.summary: Checks the modification time of a given case identifier.
Assigns a specific user to a case (the user assigned to the case can be viewed in the case top bar).
Changes the case title as presented in the case queue.
Changes the given case status to closed.
Creates an incident in the Command Center from a given case.

get.summary: Returns all the wall items (Case history) and transfers them into the incident in the Command Center.
Returns a bool value if case exists filtered by caseId

post.summary: Moves the requested alert in a given case to a new closed case.
Adds a comment to the case that will be presented in the case wall.
post.description:
**This API is deprecated and will be removed on 02-01-2024.**

Please use the following API instead: Post - api/external/v1/cases/comments

post.summary: Used to manually add an entity to an alert in a given case.
Adds a tag to the given case which can later on be used for filtering cases.
Removes a case tag that was added to a given case.
Adds or updates a task  assigned to a specific user in a given case.
Changes the case handling stage (for example, "Investigation, Triage, etc."). The case stages are set in the settings screen under the Case Data tab.
Used to change the priority of a given case (for example - informative, low, medium, high and critical).
Change the description of a given case (the description is presented in the top bar).
Generate a report for a specific case. The report will include information about the case, the entities involved, case history etc.
Changes the "is important" status of a case. You can mark or unmark the "is important" flag.
Removes the incident flag from a case.
Raises the case to "Incident" stage. Raising an incident assigns the SOC Manager as the case assignee and changes the case stage to "Incident".
Used to inject cases into the Siemplify Data Processing Engine Service.
Adds an attachment to a given case.
post.description:
**This API is deprecated and will be removed on 02-01-2024.**

Please use the following API instead: Post - api/external/v1/cases/comments

post.summary: Reassigns a case task to a specific user or role.
Execute a given playbook action.
Will skip a pending playbook action, resulting in the execution of the following steps.
Executes a single step which is part of a playbook (will trigger the re-calculation of a playbook's status).

get.summary: Returns the action result details by identifier.

post.summary: Used to perform bulk assign case action on several cases at once.
Used to perform bulk reopen case action on several cases at once.
Used to perform bulk close case action on several cases at once.
Used to perform bulk case priority change action on several cases at once.
Used to perform bulk tag addition on several cases at once.
Used to perform bulk case stage changes on several cases at once.
Used to pause alert sla.
Used to resume alert sla.
Used to update the priority of an alert.
Generate alert of the request template in your environment.

get.summary: Get all case comments by filter

post.summary: Create case comment

get.summary: Download file attached to a comment
Returns all case insights by case id and filter parameters.
Return saved filters for user.

post.summary: Add or Update filter.
Used to perform bulk close case action on several cases at once.
Used to perform bulk close case action on several cases at once.
Merge cases into a new Case.

get.summary: Provides Detailed information for the requested case

post.summary: Provides information for the alert events
Used to manually add an entity to an alert in a given case
Used to inject cases into the Siemplify Data Processing Engine Service.
Change the description of a given case - the description is presented in the top bar
Adds an evidence (attachment) to a given case.

**This API is deprecated and will be removed on 02-01-2024.**

Please use the following API instead: Post - api/external/v1/cases/comments

post.summary: Change the priority of the alert
Change the priority of the case

get.summary: Get all wall activity of the case
Get all wall activity of the case
Get file attached to a comment

post.summary: Raises the case to "Incident" stage. Raising an incident assigns the SOC Manager as the case assignee and changes the case stage to "Incident".
Adds or updates a task assigned to a specific user in a given case

requestBody.description: New or updated case task request model

post.summary: Mark task as done in case wall by the logged-in user
Removes the incident flag from a case

requestBody.description: Un-raise case as an incident request model

post.summary: Generate case report
Changes the case title
Close a case. New case related operations are not allowed on a closed case.
Adds a tag to the given case which can later on be used for filtering cases
Removes a case tag that was added to a given case
Assigns a specific user to a case - the user assigned to the case can be viewed in the case top bar

requestBody.description: Assign user or soc-role to a case request model

post.summary: Changes the case handling stage (for example, "Investigation, Triage, etc."). The case stages are set in the settings screen under the Case Data tab.
Changes the "is important" status of a case. You can mark or unmark the "is important" flag.

requestBody.description: Change the Is Important flag of a case request model

post.summary: Checks the modification time of a given case identifier

post.description:
**This API is deprecated and will be removed on 02-01-2024.**

Please use the following API instead: Post - api/external/v1/cases/comments

post.summary: Adds an evidence (attachment) to a given case.

**This API is deprecated and will be removed on 02-01-2024.**

Please use the following API instead: Post - api/external/v1/cases/comments

post.summary: Adds a comment (could be with attachment) to a given case.

**This API is deprecated and will be removed on 02-01-2024.**

Please use the following API instead: Post - api/external/v1/cases/comments

put.summary: Updates a comment and it's attachment(if needed) in a given case.
put.description:
**This API is deprecated and will be removed on 02-01-2024.**

Please use the following API instead: Put - api/external/v1/cases/comments

**This API is deprecated and will be removed on 02-01-2024.**

Please use the following API instead: Patch - api/external/v1/cases/comments/mark-as-deleted/{id}

post.summary: Move alert to new case

requestBody.description: Move alert to a new case request model

post.summary: Close alert in a case. New alert related operations are not allowed on a closed alert.

requestBody.description: Close alert in a case request model

requestBody.description: Reopen alert in a acse request model

requestBody.description: Reopen cases in bulk request model

post.summary: Move the requested case to a new environment

requestBody.description: New or updated entity property request model

get.summary: Returns all the wall items (Case history) and transfers them into the incident in the Command Center.

post.summary:
Returns minimal data related to the case (CaseCard Object).
To fetch the entire case data, use the GetCaseFullDetails method. For a more comprehensive query, you can use the search Controller.
Returns the list of alert names by environment.

get.summary: Returns all alert vendors.
Get case wall activities

patch.summary: Sets a wall item as favorite

post.summary: Returns the logs of python executions.

get.summary: Returns a summary of the Command Center incident chat according to a specific identifier.

post.summary: Sends a chat message for a specific incident in the Command Center.
Returns the conversation records of a specific chat.

get.summary: Returns a list of the departments in an incident workstation.
Returns a list of people involved in an incident workstation filtered by departments.
Returns the last severity score for a given incident by identifer.

post.summary: Saves a severity score for a given incident by identifer.

get.summary: Retrieves data regarding a Command Center incident by identifer.

post.summary: Creates a Command Center incident.
Closes an existing Command Center incident.

get.summary: Returns users associated with an incident according to their ID.
Returns Command Center user for an incident based on incident ID.
Returns a list of Command Center auditors.
Returns the forgotten password time limit in hours.

post.summary: Returns the Command Center Wall Items for a given incident.
Creates a comment in the Command Center.
Updates a given Comment in the Command Center.
Creates a Command Center Fact.
Updates a given Command Center Fact.
Creates a Command Center Decision.
Updates a given Command Center Decision.
Creates a Command Center Task under a specific user.
Updates a given Command Center Task under a specific user.
Creates a Command Center Assessment.
Updates a given Command Center Assessment.

get.summary: Creates a Command Center Report for a given incident identifier.
Provides basic information per each accessible connector.
Provides basic information per each accessible connector definition.
Retrieves detailed information regarding a specific connector instance.

delete.summary: Deletes a connector instance according to the given instance identifier.

get.summary: Details the statistics associated with the specific connector instance.

post.summary: Retrieves detailed information regarding a specific connector instance.

requestBody.description: Information which identifies the specific connector instance

post.summary: Adds a new connector instance or updates an existing one.

requestBody.description: New or updated details of a connector instance

post.summary: Updates the connector instance to its connector definition's latest version.

requestBody.description: Updated details of a connector instance

post.summary: Executes the connector once for testing purposes.

get.summary: Returns all available widget definitions. Please note that this doesnt refer to a specific dashboard.

post.summary:
Returns specific dashboard widget (including filters, order etc) and a list of values for graph representation (array of strings).
This api is being called either for a specific playbook, or for multiple playbook filters selection
Returns a list of the Case IDs involved in the widgets presented in the dashboard.
Adds a new dashboard or updates an existing one (determined by dashboard identifier).
Saves the dashboard as a report template. The report template can be viewed in the Reports module.
Imports a dashboard into the platform (json file).
Adds a new dashboard widget or update an existing one (determined by widget identifier).
Deletes a dashboard with a given dashboard identifier. Please note that the deletion of a dashboard cannot be undone.
Deletes a dashboard widget with a given widget ID. Please note that the deletion of a dashboard widget cannot be undone.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: Cases which match at least one of the filters in this list will be appended to the result.

post.summary: Returns all the environments as cards (a summary of the environment data).
Deletes a specific integration instance.

get.summary: Returns the settings of an integration instance.
Returns the names of the playbooks using a specific integration instance by their integration instance identifier.
Returns all the details of the installed integrations in the platform.

post.summary: Returns all the environments of the installed integrations in the platform.
Returns a list of the instances that are available for a specific integration according to its environment.
Creates a new integration instance.

get.summary: Returns the integration's default instance by a given integration identifier.

post.summary: Adds or updates a job in the platform.
Removes a job from the platform. Please note that this action cannot be undone.

get.summary: Returns a list of the job templates in the system that were configured in the IDE.
Returns a list of the installed jobs in the platform.

post.summary: Runs a specific job according to a specific job identifier.
Adds a new Job instance

get.summary: Returns a list of the installed jobs instances in the platform.

delete.summary: Removes a job from the platform. Please note that this action cannot be undone.

post.summary: Runs a specific job instance.

get.summary: Returns a list of integrations that can be installed and configured from the Marketplace.
Returns a list of reports that can be installed and configured from the Marketplace.
Returns a list of powerups that can be installed and configured from the Marketplace.
Returns a list of dependencies of a given integration.
Returns a list of the use cases in the system and their summary.

post.summary: Export a use case as a zip file.
Reinstall all the installed integrations in order to be up-to-date.

get.summary: Test an integration by running a test action.

post.summary: Save the integration configuration fields.
Returns all the data related to an integration (actions, connectors etc...).

get.summary: Counts the number of unread user notifications.
Returns the last 30 User notifications.
Closes all System and User notifications which will prevent them from popping up in the UI.
Closes a User Notification based on a given notification identifier to prevent it from popping up again.
Closes a System Notification based on a given notification identifier to prevent it from popping up again.
Returns the current user's notification preferences.

post.summary: Updates the user's notification preferences.

Return playbook access permission options. This should be used to fetch information when creating a
new playbook, where we do not have yet workflow guid.

Add or update permissions for a given workflow.
* Recreates all specific user permissions for that workflow
* Updates the default permissions

requestBody.description: Add permissions request containing the new permissions to set

delete.summary:
Removes all access permissions for the given workflow. Note the permissions for the notebook will be the default
permissions that is set for the playbook

parameters.name: workflowOriginalIdentifier
parameters.description: workflow original identifier to delete all of it's access permissions

get.summary: Returns a workflows (playbook) full definition, including the details of the steps in the playbook.
Returns a workflows (playbook) full definition, including the details of the steps in the playbook.
Exports a workflow (playbook) including the full definition, steps and blocks .

post.summary: Duplicate a workflow (playbook).
Duplicates a list of workflows (playbooks).

Deletes a list of workflows (playbooks).

Return statistic data related to the workflow (such as number of runs, distribution by time, etc.).

parameters.name: providerName
parameters.description: Filters by the name of the provider.

post.summary: Adds a new external provider instance.

post.summary: Creates a new mapping configuration between Identity Provider and SOAR.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of idp-group-mappings.

parameters.name: RequestedPage
parameters.description:
An integer field that represents the number of page to fetch. 
Available inputs: 0 - 9999. (default = 0).

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description:
Represents the number of Idp mappings group to present at each page.
Available inputs: 1 - 999 (default = 5).

parameters.name: OrderBy
parameters.description:
Represents order to sort by the results.
Available inputs: 0 for Descending or 1 for Ascending.

parameters.name: SortBy
parameters.description:
Represents the field to sort by the Idp Groups
Available Inputs: 0 for IdpGroup, 1 for PermissionGroup
2 for SocRoleId, 3 for Environments

parameters.name: SearchTerm
parameters.description: Search term for the Idp group identifier

get.summary: Retrieves specific mapping configuration by id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The specific id to search by.

put.summary: Updates an existing mapping configuration between Identity Provider and SOAR.

delete.summary: Deletes a mapping configuration according to a given identifier.

get.summary: Get all tag definitions names.
Return a list of the SOC roles configured in the system.

post.summary: Return a list of the SOC roles configured in the system filtered by environments.

get.summary: Return a list of the SOC roles by their identifier.
Checks if a specific SOC role has users assigned to it.

post.summary: Adds or update a SOC role in the system.
Deletes a SOC role defined in the platform.

creatorUserId.description: Identifies the user who creates this case - only relevant for cases of type Request

events.description: List of the events that make up this case

sourceSystemName.description:
Name of the source system - based on the connector
<example>VirusTotal</example>

ticketId.description: External case id received from the external product - based on the connector

description.example: The case contains several phishing alerts

displayId.description: External case display id received from the external product - based on the connector

deviceVendor.description: Case product vendor - based on the connector

deviceProduct.description: Case product vendor - based on the connector

startTime.description: Case starting time in unix format as milliseconds - based on the connector

endTime.description: Case ending time in unix format as milliseconds - based on the connector

ruleGenerator.description: Rule that generates this case - based on the connector

sourceGroupingIdentifier.description:
Source grouping identifier will be used to group alert into one case - depends on alert grouping configuration - based on the connector
<example>67e2cbc1-eaa4-4b6e-a594-fe0e6278a255</example>

playbookTriggerKeywords.description:
Playbook trigger keywords - used for 'Alert Trigger Value' playbook trigger type.
A comparison is made between those playbook keywords items and the trigger value set by the user.

attachments.description: Case attachments - based on the connector

isTrimmed.description: Flag that indicates whether the case got trimmed or not

sourceSystemUrl.description: Configured source url - defined in the connector that ingested this alert

sourceRuleIdentifier.description: Configured source rule url - defined in the connector that ingested this alert

siemAlertId.description:
Chronicle SIEM alert identifier.
            
In case the identifier is null, then, it is assumed that
it is not synced with the SIEM.
            
To avoid syncing the alert, SiemAlertId can be set to -1.

shouldCloseOldCase.description: Flag that indicates whether the current case should get closed or not

Siemplify.Common.AttacksSimulation.DataM.description: Represents the ingest case in other environment request model

id.description: Unique Identifier used to distinguish between providers.

providerName.description: Name of the provider, this field is unique.

autoRedirect.description:
Decides if user can be automatically authenticated.
When there is more than one provider this should be always false.

autoAddUser.description:
Created user dynamically when the log in based on the attributes configured.
When there is more than one provider this should be always false.

allowUnsolicitedResponse.description: User will automatically be logged in into the system from external provider application.

firstNameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which first name is extracted.

lastNameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which last name is extracted.

usernameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which login id is extracted.

emailAttribute.description: Name of the field from which user email is extracted.

defaultSocRoleId.description: The role of the new user.(only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

defaultPermissionGroup.description: The permission group of the new user. (only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

defaultEnvironments.description: The environments the new user will be exposed to. (only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

providerName.description: Name of the provider, this field is unique.

autoRedirect.description:
Decides if user can be automatically authenticated.
When there is more than one provider this should be always false.

autoAddUser.description:
Created user dynamically when the log in based on the attributes configured.
When there is more than one provider this should be always false.

allowUnsolicitedResponse.description: User will automatically be logged in into the system from external provider application.

firstNameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which first name is extracted.

lastNameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which last name is extracted.

usernameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which login id is extracted.

emailAttribute.description: Name of the field from which user email is extracted.

defaultSocRoleId.description: The role of the new user.(only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

defaultPermissionGroup.description: The permission group of the new user. (only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

defaultEnvironments.description: The environments the new user will be exposed to. (only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

Siemplify.Common.Authentication.Apis.Ext.description: Request for creating or updating external authentication settings (saml settings)

id.description: The identifier of the mapping group.

idpGroup.description: The permission group on the target Identity Provider.

permissionGroup.description: The permission group in soar associated with the mapping group.

socRoleId.description:
The identifier of the soc-role associated with the mapping group.
ex. 2 - for Tier-1 soc-role group.

environments.description: List of strings representing the environments associated with the mapping group.

idpGroup.description: The permission group on the target Identity Provider.

permissionGroup.description: The permission group in soar associated with the mapping group.

socRoleId.description:
The identifier of the soc-role associated with the mapping group.
ex. 2 - for Tier-1 soc-role group.

environments.description: List of strings representing the environments associated with the mapping group.

providerName.description: Name of the provider, this field is unique.

autoRedirect.description:
Decides if user can be automatically authenticated.
When there is more than one provider this should be always false.

autoAddUser.description:
Created user dynamically when the log in based on the attributes configured.
When there is more than one provider this should be always false.

allowUnsolicitedResponse.description: User will automatically be logged in into the system from external provider application.

firstNameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which first name is extracted.

lastNameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which last name is extracted.

usernameAttribute.description: Name of the field from which login id is extracted.

emailAttribute.description: Name of the field from which user email is extracted.

defaultSocRoleId.description: The role of the new user.(only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

defaultPermissionGroup.description: The permission group of the new user. (only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

defaultEnvironments.description: The environments the new user will be exposed to. (only applicable on just in time user provisioning).

creationTimeUnixTimeInMs.description: Alert ingestion time in unix format as milliseconds

modificationTimeUnixTimeInMs.description: Alert modification time internally in unix format as milliseconds

startTime.description:
Alert start time in unix format as milliseconds.
Start time of the first event.

endTime.description:
Alert end time in unix format as milliseconds.
End time of the last event.

alertGroupIdentifier.description:
Group identifier of the alert which is unique across the system. Identifier property can be identical for 2 alerts in 2 different environments.
AlertGroupIdentifier structure - {Identifier}_{Guid.New}.

eventsCount.description: Number of events the alert contains

ruleGenerator.description: Rule that generates this alert - based on the connector

deviceProduct.description: Source product that the alert ingested from.

playbookAttached.description: Name of the selected playbook attached to the alert. The playbook selected is the one with the highest priority. If there are a few playbooks with the same priority, the server will use the one that was created first.

playbookRunCount.description: Run count of the selected playbook attached to the alert. The playbook selected is the one with the highest priority. If there are a few playbooks with the same priority, the server will use the one that was created first.

isManualAlert.description: Flag that indicates whether the alert was created manually - currently not in use

sourceUrl.description: Configured source url - defined in the connector that ingested this alert

sourceRuleUrl.description: Configured source rule url - defined in the connector that ingested this alert

siemAlertId.description:
Chronicle SIEM alert identifier.
            
In case the identifier is null, then, it is assumed that
it is not synced with the SIEM.
            
To avoid syncing the alert, SiemAlertId can be set to -1.

Siemplify.Common.CasesV2.DataModel.Alert.description: Represents an alert card in the system

List of the event field groups
Groups of RawFields

port.description: Event port - based on the connector

Name of the source system - based on the connector
<example>VirusTotal</example>

outcome.description: Event category outcome - based on the connector

Event time value
Determine by fall back hierarchy, startTime -> endTime -> managerReceiptTime by that order

artifactEntities.description: List of entities that cataloged as artifacts

blockStepIdentifier.description:
Represents the nested block step identifier from a playbook;
Only used when the current widget is a predefined widget linked to step inside a block;

blockStepInstanceName.description:
Represents the nested block step instance name from a playbook;
Only used when the current widget is a predefined widget linked to step inside a block;

slaExpirationTime.description: SLA expiration time in unix format as milliseconds

criticalExpirationTime.description: SLA critical expiration time in unix format as milliseconds

filter.description:
Optional. A filter that chooses which log entries to return.
See Advanced Logs Queries (https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/view/advanced-queries).
Only log entries that match the filter are returned.
An empty filter matches all log entries.
The maximum length of the filter is 10000 characters.
The filter supports the following properties for siemplify components:
    labels.integration_name
    labels.integration_instance
    labels.integration_version
    labels.connector_name
    labels.connector_instance
    labels.action_name
    jsonPayload.job_name

pageToken.description: The token returned from the previous request. A value of an empty string retrieves the first page. Optional.

pageSize.description:
The size of page to request. The response will not be larger than this, but may be smaller.
A value of null or 0 uses a server-defined page size of 1000. Max value is 10000.

sortOrder.description:
Optional. How the results should be sorted. Presently, the only permitted values are "asc" (default) and "desc".
The first option returns entries in order of increasing values of LogEntry.timestamp (oldest first),
and the second option returns entries in order of decreasing timestamps (newest first).
Entries with equal timestamps are returned in order of their insert_id values.

pageToken.description: The token returned from the previous request. A value of an empty string retrieves the first page.

filter.description: Request filter provided from the previous request.

identifier.description: The identifier of the described connector.

isEnabled.description: Describes whether the connector is currently enabled.

isRemote.description:
Determines whether the connector is in remote mode (executed on a remote machine using an agent) or
locally as part of the deployment.

Siemplify.Common.ConnectorsManagement.Da.description:
Connector card groups related information regarding a specific connector.
Mostly being used for UI client purposes.

identifier.description: The identifier of the described connector.

connectorDefinitionName.description: The name of the connector definition, which this connector instance was derived from.

displayName.description: The name of the connector instance.

description.description: Short description about this connector instance.
description.example: This connector ingests alerts from Google Chronicle SIEM.

environment.description: The environment which the connector is associated with.

isEnabled.description: Determines whether this connector instance is enabled or not.

runIntervalInSeconds.description: The period of time in seconds between each new execution of this connector instance.

isRemote.description:
Determines whether the connector is in remote mode (executed on a remote machine using an agent) or
locally as part of the deployment.

agentIdentifier.description: Represents the agent identifier in case the connector is executed in remote mode, otherwise, null.

deviceProductField.description: The source field name which assists in parsing the product name.

eventNameField.description: The source field name which assists in parsing the event name.

version.description: The version of the connector definition.

parameters.description: A list of parameters which the connector executor expects to use.

allowList.description:
A list of filters which can be used by the connector instance. Regularly, filters are
assembled according to the integration specifications.

Siemplify.Common.ConnectorsManagement.Da.description: Represents a connector instance parameter's key and its corresponding value.

isSuccess.description: Determines whether the test run completed successfully or not.

debugOutput.description: Full debug output of the connector executor.

sampleCases.description: Sample data which has been produced by the connector test run.

Siemplify.Common.ConnectorsManagement.Da.description: Represents a connector instance test run result.

alertName.description: The name of the sample alert.

product.description: The name of the product which produced the alert.

eventCount.description: Number of events which make up the whole alert.

caseInfoJson.description: Full JSON information which makes the whole alert as received from the connector.

Siemplify.Common.ConnectorsManagement.Da.description: Sample of data which is produced during a test run of a connector.

connectorIdentifier.description: The identifier of the connector instance.

amountAlertsInLastDay.description: Represents the number of alerts ingested over the last day by this connector instance.

avgAlertsPerDay.description: Represents the average number of daily ingested alerts by this connector instance.

identifier.description: The identifier of the described connector.

isEnabled.description: Determine whether this connector instance is enabled or not.

isRemote.description:
Determine whether the connector is in remote mode (executed on a remote machine using an agent) or
locally as part of the deployment.

agentIdentifier.description: Represent the agent identifier in case the connector is executed in remote mode, otherwise, null.

parameters.description: A list of parameters which the connector executor expects to use.

isAllowlistSupported.description: Determine whether allow list is supported for this connector instance.

allowList.description:
A list of filters which can be used by the connector instance. Regularly, filters are
assembled according to the integration specifications.

runIntervalInSeconds.description: The period of time in seconds between each new execution of this connector instance.

deviceProductField.description: The source field name which assists in parsing the product name.

eventNameField.description: The source field name which assists in parsing the event name.

version.description: The version of the connector definition.

documentationLink.description: A link to the documentation of the connector.

isUpdateAvailable.description: Determine whether this connector definition has been modified recently, and should be updated.

loggingEnabledUntilUnixMs.description:
Represent the time (unix time in milliseconds) when connector logs will be stopped for this instance.
In case logs are disabled, its value equals to 0.

isAdvanced.description: Determines whether this parameter should get precedence over non-advanced parameters.

cards.description: Connector cards which are associated with the integration.

integration.description: The name of the integration which this connector definition is associated with.

connectorDefinitionName.description: The name of the connector definition, which this connector instance was derived from.

agentIdentifier.description: Represents the agent identifier in case the connector is executed in remote mode, otherwise, null.

Siemplify.Common.EntityExplorer.DataMode.description: Represents the ingest case in other environment request model

startTime.description:
Defines the UTC start time to search for cases by Creation time
(optional - used if TimeRangeFilter is set to Custom filter).
The Localization (timezone) settings are taken into consideration (default is the start of epoch time).

endTime.description:
Defines the UTC end time to search for cases by Creation time
(optional - used if TimeRangeFilter is set to Custom filter).
The Localization (timezone) settings are taken into consideration (default is current time).

tags.description:
List of strings representing case tags.
If one or more tags exist in the case, it will be fetched.

caseSource.description:
List of strings representing case sources.
Available inputs: System / Manual / Test.

priorities.description: List of strings representing case priority

importance.description:
List of strings representing the case importance (i.e. marked as "is important").
ex. ["True"] will return only cases that were marked as important.
ex. ["True","False] Will return only cases marked as important and all cases not marked as important (all).
Available inputs: True / False.

incident.description:
List of strings representing cases marked as incidents.
ex. ["True"] will return only cases that were marked as an incident.
ex. ["True","False"] Will return all cases marked as an incident and all cases not marked as an incident (all).
Available inputs: True / False.

environments.description:
List of strings representing the environments that the case is associated with.
If the case matches at least one environment it will be fetched.

assignedUsers.description:
A list of strings that represents the Users (analysts) / Roles that are assigned to the case.
If the case matches at least one User or Role it will be fetched.
Available inputs: Username (GUID) / @Role name.

externalAlertId.description: Represents the 'TicketId' mapped from the original SIEM's alert ID

products.description:
list of strings that represent the Products that exists in the case.
If the case matches at least one Product it will be fetched.

ports.description:
List of strings that represent the ports that exist in the case.
If the case matches at least one Port it will be fetched.

stage.description:
List of strings that represents the Stages that case is on.
If the case matches at least one Stage it will be fetched.
Available inputs: Triage / Assessment / Investigation / Incident / Improvement / Research.

ruleGenerator.description:
List of strings that represents the Rule Generator (Alert Type in the Platform) that exist in the case.
If the case matches at least one Rule Generator it will be fetched.

categoryOutcomes.description:
List of strings that represents whether to fetch cases that contain a specific value in CategoryOutcome.
Available inputs: Allowed / Blocked / [] (empty).

involvedEntity.description: A string that represents an entity to search for in cases

caseComment.description: A string that represents a part of the body of a case comment to search for in cases

title.description:
A string that represents free text / search term to search for cases.
Free text will look for the case's name.
Available inputs: free text / Entity: / AlertName: / DestinationEntity: / SourceEntity: / TicketIds: / CaseIDs:

isCaseClosed.description:
A boolean field that represents whether to filter by the case status (is closed or not).
Available inputs: true / false / null.

requestedPage.description:
An integer field that represents the number of page to fetch. 
Available inputs: 0 - 9999.

pageSize.description:
Represents the number of cases to present at each page.
Available inputs: 1 - 999 (default = 50).
